keyword: how many calories in a half banana
title: How Many Calories in a Half Banana?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a half banana, including carbs, fiber, sugars, protein, fat, and quick tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Half Banana?
assumptions: Medium banana (≈118 g peeled), ripe, raw; half refers to one-half of the fruit.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by banana size, ripeness, variety, and storage; values are approximate. Check produce labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A half medium banana provides ~53 kcal, 14 g carbs, and 1.6 g fiber.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Frozen and blended into smoothie (no additives)

faqs.q: How many calories in a half banana?
faqs.a: About 53 kcal for half a medium banana.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a half banana?
faqs.a: Approximately 13.5 g carbs, including 1.6 g fiber and 7.2 g sugars.

faqs.q: Is a half banana low in protein or fat?
faqs.a: Yes—only 0.7 g protein and 0.2 g fat, making it mostly carbs.

faqs.q: How does banana size affect calories?
faqs.a: Smaller bananas have fewer calories (e.g., ~42 kcal whole); larger ones more (up to 120 kcal).

faqs.q: Are bananas high in sodium or cholesterol?
faqs.a: No—negligible sodium (1 mg) and zero cholesterol per half banana.
